com.immersion.uhl
Class Device

java.lang.Object
  com.immersion.uhl.Device

public class Device
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates a device handle representing an open device.

Method Detail

newDevice

public static Device newDevice(android.content.Context context)
                        throws java.lang.RuntimeException
Opens and initializes a composite device that supports playing different effects simultaneously on different actuators.

Effects may specify the index of an actuator on which to play the effect. When played on a composite device, the effects are rendered on the actuator corresponding to the specified actuator index.

Effects played on this device can address any of the available actuators.

Parameters:
context - Application context.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error opening the composite device.
"VIBE_E_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY"
The API cannot allocate memory to complete the request. This happens when the system runs low in memory.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.

newDevice

public static Device newDevice(android.content.Context context,
                               int deviceIndex)
                        throws java.lang.RuntimeException
Opens and initializes a device representing a specified actuator.

Effects played on this device can play only on the specified actuator.

Parameters:
context - Application context.
deviceIndex - Index of the actuator to use. The index of the actuator must be greater than or equal to zero, and less than the number of actuators returned by ImmVibe.getDeviceCount.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
The deviceIndex parameter is negative, or greater than or equal to the number of devices returned by ImmVibe.getDeviceCount.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error opening the device.
"VIBE_E_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY"
The API cannot allocate memory to complete the request. This happens when the system runs low in memory.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.

close

public void close()
Closes this device.

Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
This device has been closed by a previous call to close.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error closing this device.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.

getState

public int getState()
Gets the status bits of this device.

Returns:
Status bits of this device, bitwise ORing of
  • ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVICESTATE_ATTACHED
  • ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVICESTATE_BUSY
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
This device is a composite device. The API only supports getting the status bits of single-actuator devices created using newDevice(Context, int).
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error getting this device's state.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.

getCapabilityBool

public boolean getCapabilityBool(int devCapType)
Gets a boolean capability of this device.

This function is provided for future use. The devices supported by the current version of the API do not have boolean capabilities.

Parameters:
devCapType - Device capability type of the boolean capability to get.
Returns:
Requested boolean capability of this device.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INCOMPATIBLE_CAPABILITY_TYPE"
The devCapType parameter does not specify a boolean capability of this device.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.

getMsDelay

public int getMsDelay()
Gets the delay used by functions that play delayed effects. The functions are
  • playIVTEffectDelayed
  • playIVTEffectRepeatDelayed
  • playMagSweepEffectDelayed
  • playPeriodicEffectDelayed
  • playWaveformEffectDelayed

Returns:
Number of milliseconds for which effect playback is delayed.

setMsDelay

public void setMsDelay(int msDelay)
Sets the delay used by functions that play delayed effects. The functions are
  • playIVTEffectDelayed
  • playIVTEffectRepeatDelayed
  • playMagSweepEffectDelayed
  • playPeriodicEffectDelayed
  • playWaveformEffectDelayed

Parameters:
msDelay - Number of milliseconds for which effect playback is delayed.

playIVTEffect

public EffectHandle playIVTEffect(IVTBuffer ivt,
                                  int effectIndex)
Plays an effect defined in IVT data.

Parameters:
ivt - IVT buffer containing the definition of the effect to play. Use ImmVibe.getBuiltInEffects to access built-in IVT effects.
effectIndex - Index of the effect to play. The index of the effect must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the number of effects returned by IVTBuffer.getEffectCount.
Returns:
Handle to the playing effect.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This device has been closed by a previous call to close.
  • The ivt parameter is invalid or contains invalid IVT data.
  • The effectIndex parameter is negative, or greater than or equal to the value returned by IVTBuffer.getEffectCount.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error playing the effect.
"VIBE_E_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY"
The API cannot allocate memory to complete the request. This happens when the system runs low in memory.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.

playIVTInterpolatedEffect

public EffectHandle playIVTInterpolatedEffect(IVTBuffer ivt,
                                              int effectIndex,
                                              int interpolant)
Plays an interpolated effect defined in IVT data.

Parameters:
ivt - IVT buffer containing the definition of the effect to play. Use IVTBuffer.getBuiltInEffects to access built-in IVT effects.
effectIndex - Index of the effect to play. The index of the effect must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the number of effects returned by IVTBuffer.getEffectCount.
interpolant - Initial interpolant value for the interpolated effect. The interpolant value must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to VIBE_MAX_INTERPOLANT. The interpolant value may be subsequently modified by calling EffectHandle.modifyPlayingInterpolatedEffectInterpolant(int).
Returns:
Handle to the playing effect.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This device has been closed by a previous call to close.
  • The ivt parameter is invalid or contains invalid IVT data.
  • The effectIndex parameter is negative, or greater than or equal to the value returned by IVTBuffer.getEffectCount.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error playing the effect.
"VIBE_E_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY"
The API cannot allocate memory to complete the request. This happens when the system runs low in memory.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.

interpolant - Initial interpolant value for the interpolated effect. The interpolant value must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to VIBE_MAX_INTERPOLANT. The interpolant value may be subsequently modified by calling EffectHandle.modifyPlayingInterpolatedEffectInterpolant(int).

playIVTEffectRepeat

public EffectHandle playIVTEffectRepeat(IVTBuffer ivt,
                                        int effectIndex,
                                        byte repeat)
Repeatedly plays a Timeline effect defined in IVT data.

This function repeats only Timeline effects. If the given effect index refers to a simple effect, playIVTEffectRepeat ignores the repeat parameter and plays the simple effect once. In that case, playIVTEffectRepeat behaves like playIVTEffect. To determine the type of an IVT effect, call IVTBuffer.getEffectType.

Parameters:
ivt - IVT buffer containing the definition of the effect to play. Use ImmVibe.getBuiltInEffects to access built-in IVT effects.
effectIndex - Index of the effect to play. The index of the effect must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the number of effects returned by IVTBuffer.getEffectCount.
repeat - Number of times to repeat the effect. To play the effect indefinitely, set repeat to ImmVibe.VIBE_REPEAT_COUNT_INFINITE. To repeat the effect a finite number of times, set repeat to a value from zero to ImmVibe.VIBE_REPEAT_COUNT_INFINITE - 1. Setting repeat to zero plays the effect once (repeats the effect zero times) and is equivalent to calling playIVTEffect. To stop the effect before it has repeated the requested number of times, or to stop an effect that is playing indefinitely, call EffectHandle.stop or stopAllPlayingEffects.
Returns:
Handle to the playing effect.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This device has been closed by a previous call to close.
  • The ivt parameter is invalid or contains invalid IVT data.
  • The effectIndex parameter is negative, or greater than or equal to the value returned by IVTBuffer.getEffectCount.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error playing the effect.
"VIBE_E_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY"
The API cannot allocate memory to complete the request. This happens when the system runs low in memory.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.

playIVTEffectRepeatDelayed

public EffectHandle playIVTEffectRepeatDelayed(IVTBuffer ivt,
                                               int effectIndex,
                                               byte repeat)
Repeatedly plays a Timeline effect defined in IVT data after a delay specified in a previous call to setMsDelay.

This function repeats only Timeline effects. If the given effect index refers to a simple effect, playIVTEffectRepeatDelayed ignores the repeat parameter and plays the simple effect once. In that case, playIVTEffectRepeatDelayed behaves like playIVTEffectDelayed. To determine the type of an IVT effect, call IVTBuffer.getEffectType.

Parameters:
ivt - IVT buffer containing the definition of the effect to play. Use ImmVibe.getBuiltInEffects to access built-in IVT effects.
effectIndex - Index of the effect to play. The index of the effect must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the number of effects returned by IVTBuffer.getEffectCount.
repeat - Number of times to repeat the effect. To play the effect indefinitely, set repeat to ImmVibe.VIBE_REPEAT_COUNT_INFINITE. To repeat the effect a finite number of times, set repeat to a value from zero to ImmVibe.VIBE_REPEAT_COUNT_INFINITE - 1. Setting repeat to zero plays the effect once (repeats the effect zero times) and is equivalent to calling playIVTEffect. To stop the effect before it has repeated the requested number of times, or to stop an effect that is playing indefinitely, call EffectHandle.stop or stopAllPlayingEffects.
Returns:
Handle to the playing effect.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This device has been closed by a previous call to close.
  • The ivt parameter is invalid or contains invalid IVT data.
  • The effectIndex parameter is negative, or greater than or equal to the value returned by IVTBuffer.getEffectCount.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error playing the effect.
"VIBE_E_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY"
The API cannot allocate memory to complete the request. This happens when the system runs low in memory.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.

playWaveformEffect

public EffectHandle playWaveformEffect(WaveformEffectDefinition definition)
Plays a Waveform effect given the parameters defining the effect.

This function is supported only in the 5000 API edition. To get the API edition level, call getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

Parameters:
definition - Definition of the effect parameters.
Returns:
Handle to the playing effect.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This device has been closed by a previous call to close.
  • The value of one or more of the effect parameters is invalid.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error playing the effect.
"VIBE_E_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY"
The API cannot allocate memory to complete the request. This happens when the system runs low in memory.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.
"VIBE_E_NOT_SUPPORTED"
This function is not supported in the 3000 and 4000 API editions. To get the API edition level, call getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

playWaveformEffectDelayed

public EffectHandle playWaveformEffectDelayed(WaveformEffectDefinition definition)
Plays a Waveform effect given the parameters defining the effect after a delay specified in a previous call to setMsDelay.

This function is supported only in the 5000 API edition. To get the API edition level, call getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

Parameters:
definition - Definition of the effect parameters.
Returns:
Handle to the playing effect.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
One or more of the arguments is invalid; for example,
  • This device has been closed by a previous call to close.
  • The value of one or more of the effect parameters is invalid.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error playing the effect.
"VIBE_E_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY"
The API cannot allocate memory to complete the request. This happens when the system runs low in memory.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.
"VIBE_E_NOT_SUPPORTED"
This function is not supported in the 3000 and 4000 API editions. To get the API edition level, call getCapabilityInt32 with the ImmVibe.VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_EDITION_LEVEL device capability type.

createStreamingEffect

public EffectHandle createStreamingEffect()
Creates a Streaming effect.

Call createStreamingEffect to create a new Streaming effect and get a handle to the new effect. Use that effect handle to play Streaming Samples by calling EffectHandle.playStreamingSample or EffectHandle.playStreamingSampleWithOffset.

Returns:
Handle to the created effect.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
This device has been closed by a previous call to close.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error creating the effect.
"VIBE_E_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY"
The API cannot allocate memory to complete the request. This happens when the system runs low in memory.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.

stopAllPlayingEffects

public void stopAllPlayingEffects()
Stops all playing and paused effects on a device.

Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
This device has been closed by a previous call to close.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error stopping all effects.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.
